name: Greenland
hint: World's largest island, an autonomous territory of Denmark covered in ice

name: Cuba
hint: Largest island in the Caribbean, famous for cigars, salsa music, and classic cars

name: Hispaniola
hint: Second-largest Caribbean island, shared by Haiti and the Dominican Republic

name: Jamaica
hint: Caribbean island birthplace of reggae music, jerk cuisine, and Blue Mountain coffee

name: Puerto Rico
hint: US territory in the Caribbean with bioluminescent bays and a rainforest

name: Baffin Island
hint: Largest island in Canada and fifth-largest in the world, in the Arctic Archipelago

name: Vancouver Island
hint: Largest island on the Pacific coast of North America, in British Columbia

name: Newfoundland
hint: Large island off eastern Canada, where Vikings first landed in North America

name: Hawaii (Big Island)
hint: Largest and youngest Hawaiian island, still growing from active volcanic eruptions

name: Bermuda
hint: British territory in the Atlantic famous for pink sand beaches and the Bermuda Triangle

name: Trinidad
hint: Larger island of Trinidad and Tobago, known for Carnival and calypso music

name: Ellesmere Island
hint: Canada's northernmost island and third-largest, with glaciers and Arctic wildlife

name: Long Island
hint: Island east of Manhattan in New York, home to suburbs, beaches, and wine country

name: Cozumel
hint: Mexican Caribbean island off the Yucatan, world-renowned for its coral reef diving

name: Kodiak Island
hint: Large Alaskan island famous for its enormous brown bears, the Kodiak bears
